intro: Dortmanna linarioides, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are linear and closely spaced, contributing to its compact, mat-like growth form. Dortmanna linarioides is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
